question: 足首
sourceMnemonic: What is the <kanji>neck</kanji> of your <kanji>leg</kanji>? Think about it. It's your <vocabulary>ankle</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the kun'yomi readings from both kanji, probably because it includes body parts. You know the kun'yomi reading of <ja>足</ja> from previous vocab and you know the kun'yomi reading of <ja>首</ja> from learning that kanji. So, you should be able to read this kanji so long as you remember that it's all kun'yomi.
